8f336a34-5c28-4a06-bf6b-da5f18ee442a.description: The CMA is the flagship program of the CMA ANZ. On completion, participants develop advanced skills of analysis, evaluation, and synthesis in the areas of strategic cost and management accounting and business analysis; and, in the process, obtained an in-depth awareness of the current developments in the profession.
8f336a34-5c28-4a06-bf6b-da5f18ee442a.name: Certified Management Accountant (CMA)

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

entity.name: Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

alignments.name: The New Zealand Qualifications Authority (NZQA).
alignments.description: The CMA has been assessed as equivalent to Level 9 (Masters Degree) under the New Zealand Qualifications Framework (NZQF)

badge_template_activities.title: Degree in Accounting, Commerce or Finance, or an MBA, from a recognised university or a Professional Qualification in Accounting
Completion the 2 subjects in the CMA preparatory program (Strategic Cost Management and Strategic Business Analysis) via face-to-face lectures, online, or Zoom.
Minimum of 5 years relevant work experience in business.
Must maintain CMA membership in good standing and comply with the CPD requirements with no outstanding complaints or disciplinary proceedings

87828677-6f32-4b39-9688-76904f3f3c00.description: The RCA qualification caters those requiring essential skills as an accounting support officer and bookkeeper. Students gain practical knowledge of a variety of accounting and bookkeeping skills necessary for the workplace, including preparing financial reports and budgets and basic costing. Bookkeepers and cost accountants are necessary across industries.
87828677-6f32-4b39-9688-76904f3f3c00.name: Registered Cost Accountant (RCA)

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

entity.name: Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

alignments.name: The New Zealand Qualifications Authority (NZQA)
alignments.description: The RCA has been assessed as equivalent to Level 5 (Diploma) under the New Zealand Qualifications Framework (NZQF)

badge_template_activities.title: Diploma in Accounting from a recognised Technical College (TAFE) or 2 Stages of a Professional Qualification in Accounting or completion of Stages 1 & 2 of the ICMA’s Graduate program
Must maintain RCA membership in good standing and comply with the CPD requirements with no outstanding complaints or disciplinary proceedings

ec94460f-ca4d-4601-9e41-f3d408a32df7.description: AMA is the associate-level professional program of the CMA(ANZ). To be recognised as an AMA participants must demonstrate skills of analysis, evaluation and synthesis in the areas of Financial Modelling, Financial Management, Financial Statement Analysis and Management Accounting; and, in the process, obtained a good awareness of the current developments in the profession. In addition, AMAs also require 3-years of business related experience.
ec94460f-ca4d-4601-9e41-f3d408a32df7.name: Associate Management Accountant (AMA)

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

entity.name: Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

alignments.name: The New Zealand Qualifications Authority (NZQA).
alignments.description: The AMA is obtained after completing the GMA education program and obtaining 3-years business experience. The GMA has been assessed as equivalent to Level 7 (Degree) under the New Zealand Qualifications Framework (NZQF).

badge_template_activities.title: Degree in Accounting, Commerce or Finance, or an MBA, from a recognised university or a Professional Qualification in Accounting
Completion or RPL of the Graduate Management Accounting preparatory program, or completion of the Graduate Conversion Program.
Minimum of 3 years relevant work experience in business.
Must maintain AMA membership in good standing and comply with the CPD requirements with no outstanding complaints or disciplinary proceedings.

6dea6086-66a9-4869-949c-2f1c7f1c46d9.description: Fellow – entitled to use the designatory letters FCMA: Entitlement to FCMA membership is via both Objective and Subjective Admission. This membership category is by invitation only for persons who have supported the Institute as a qualified financial member for a minimum period of 15 years and/or has demonstrated ongoing professional commitment by participating in the activities of the ICMA Council or their respective Regional Offices.
6dea6086-66a9-4869-949c-2f1c7f1c46d9.name: Fellow Certified Management Accountant (FCMA)

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

entity.name: Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

alignments.name: The New Zealand Qualifications Authority (NZQA)
alignments.description: The FCMA grade on Membership is available only after a minimum of 5 years uninterrupted membership of at the CMA grade. The CMA has been assessed as equivalent to Level 9 (Masters Degree) under the New Zealand Qualifications Framework (NZQF).

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of 15 years’ work experience in Accounting / Finance or business. Minimum of 5 years’ work experience at a very senior level CFO / COO / CEO of a reputed corporation.

Extraordinary and outstanding contribution to the Accounting Profession with a special emphasis on Management Accounting; and/or Outstanding contribution and service to CMA(ANZ) by way of: - Research, teaching etc., - Organizing events, symposiums etc., - Community service which reflects well on CMA(ANZ), - Any other contribution and service to CMA(ANZ).

Minimum 5 years uninterrupted membership of CMA (ANZ) at the CMA grade. Must maintain FCMA membership in good standing and comply with the CPD requirements with no outstanding complaints or disciplinary proceedings

8c44ddae-327c-4c54-b248-09472cf9fc2e.description: GMA is the graduate-level professional program of the CMA ANZ. To be recognised as an GMA participants must demonstrate skills of analysis, evaluation and synthesis in the areas of Financial Modelling, Financial Management, Financial Statement Analysis and Management Accounting; and, in the process, obtained a good awareness of the current developments in the profession.
8c44ddae-327c-4c54-b248-09472cf9fc2e.name: Graduate Management Accountant (GMA)

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

entity.name: Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

alignments.name: The New Zealand Qualifications Authority (NZQA).
alignments.description: The GMA has been assessed as equivalent to Level 7 (Degree) under the New Zealand Qualifications Framework (NZQF).

badge_template_activities.title: Degree in Accounting, Commerce or Finance, or an MBA, from a recognised university or a Professional Qualification in Accounting
Completion or RPL of the Graduate Management Accounting preparatory program, or completion of the Graduate Conversion Program.
Have 0 - 3 years relevant work experience
Must maintain GMA membership in good standing and comply with the CPD requirements with no outstanding complaints or disciplinary proceedings.

e0c43789-7f94-47ac-9688-095dbad95ef9.description: Accounting technicians work across sectors in private, public and not for profit organisations. They carry out a range of practical accountancy, financial and taxation work. This work includes: (a) checking and analysing financial information used by accountants; (b) preparing financial information required by professional accountants.
e0c43789-7f94-47ac-9688-095dbad95ef9.name: Certified Accounting Technician (CAT)

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

entity.name: Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

alignments.name: The New Zealand Qualifications Authority (NZQA)
alignments.description: The CAT has been assessed as equivalent to Level 5 (Certificate) under the New Zealand Qualifications Framework (NZQF)

badge_template_activities.title: Certificate in Accounting from a recognised Technical College (TAFE) or Stage 1 of a Professional Qualification in Accounting or completion of Stage 1 of the CMA ANZ’s Graduate program
Must maintain CAT membership in good standing and comply with the CPD requirements with no outstanding complaints or disciplinary proceedings

348df727-da22-43dd-a9ea-3e4ea8311273.description: The CGBA® is the premier global business analysis designation that recognises a unique group of corporate analysts who have reached the highest benchmark of quality and competence in strategic business analysis. The CGBA designation distinguishes professionals who have advanced proficiency in strategy, marketing, supply chain, finance, valuation, operations, and management. CGBA maintains the highest relevance with employers and develops the competencies in business analysis most in demand.
348df727-da22-43dd-a9ea-3e4ea8311273.name: Certified Global Business Analyst (CGBA)

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

entity.name: Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

badge_template_activities.title: Degree or professional qualification in any business discipline (both accounting and non-accounting) and 5-years of business experience. Non-business degree holders and professionals also are eligible if they have over 10-years of business experience.
Completion of the Strategic Business Analysis course in the CMA preparatory program.
Minimum of 5 years relevant work experience.

The CGBA is a Certification program (not an ICMA Membership grade). As such, to be eligible to hold the CGBA certification, ICMA membership is required at the minimum Management Accounting Affiliate (MAA) grade. The fee for the CGBA certification is A$ 150 for three years use of the post-nominals CGBA. (This also includes the Management Accounting Affiliate (MAA) fee for 3-years if you are not already an ICMA(ANZ) member at a higher grade).

8626a28d-9ad5-4e89-a0c0-f163e7bd0ab8.description: The RBA qualification caters to Individuals currently working in financial and management accounting roles who are seeking a formal qualification to boost and confirm their existing knowledge and skills. This qualification is ideal for those seeking the knowledge of financial statements, provide management accounting information, prepare financial reports for corporate entities, and manage budgets and forecasts.
8626a28d-9ad5-4e89-a0c0-f163e7bd0ab8.name: Registered Business Accountant (RBA)

issuer.summary: issued by Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

entity.name: Institute of Certified Management Accountants, Australia & NZ (CMA ANZ)

alignments.name: The New Zealand Qualifications Authority (NZQA)
alignments.description: The RBA has been assessed as equivalent to Level 6 (Advanced Diploma) under the New Zealand Qualifications Framework (NZQF).

badge_template_activities.title: An Advanced Diploma in Accounting from a recognised Technical College (TAFE) or 3 Stages of a Professional Qualification in Accounting or completion of Stages 1,2 & 3 of the ICMA’s Graduate program.
Must maintain RBA membership in good standing and comply with the CPD requirements with no outstanding complaints or disciplinary proceedings
